name: Terrasse des Elephants

reviews.text: I chose the hotel for its central location and was not disappointed. Night market, pub alley are less than a 5 minute walk away and opposite there is a small supermarket to stock up on water and other essentials, plenty of tour operators to organize your trip to Angkor Wat and even an optician. The hotel has no elevator (at least I did not see it) so be prepared to haul your bag up the stairs (or let the staff do it and feel guilty). Rooms are decorated in what I would call Khmer baroque which looked nice on the website but is a bit impractical in reality. Having the shower in the middle of the room took some getting used to and there was not enough space around the sink for my toiletries. My room was close to the pool area which was fantastic and also had a tiny balcony with a view. Despite the central location, there was no noise. Everything worked perfectly and there is a coffee maker with nescafe which is great as Cambodian coffee is not the greatest in the world. The wifi signal was weak occasionally but the staff did their best to assist, the restaurant is nice, good food, reasonable prices and nice cocktails. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought the Terrasse of the Elephants looked really quirky online and i had read all the reviews both very good and not so good.
reviews.title: Unique and Friendly......But not for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a spacious roof top room for two nights and spent one night in the pool level rooms. The roof top room was much nicer, the pool level one we stayed in smelt musty and damp.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The girls at reception are helpful, the 'waitresses' are hard working, capable and very friendly, the 'waiters' lacked in service skills or perhaps just experience in comparison to the girls. I feel awful mentioning it, but there was a distinct difference. The two female managers were on hand at all times and dealt with a situation we had in a satisfactory way. We could not fault there sincerity.
reviews.title: Best in Siem Reap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our laundry was done quickly and smelt lovely. The hotel has a Mercedes and driver available for hire.
reviews.title: the best hotel of siem reap !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights primarily for visiting the Angkor temples. This hotel looked quirky and had many good reviews and as people who like something different we decided to book a room. We were not disappointed. The hotel building is in an excellent location being literally a couple of minutes from the night market, pub street and the alley. So all you shopping, eating and drinking needs are on your door step.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great location and lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel building has the air of an old colonial structure with the lovely khmer design features added. The bedrooms are large and very nice with the unique bathroom feature being like a Bayon temple in your room. The shower experience was something different in a good way. The rooms were very clean and there was an outdoor balcony also.
reviews.title: Distinctive design, wonderful hotel

reviews.text: All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful from the excellent Chanty on reception, to the waiting staff and the chaps at the pool bar on the room who mix up a mean mojito for happy hour ($2 for cocktails!!! get in!!).
reviews.title: Out of this world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooftop pool area is a very welcome addition after a morning and afternoon of sightseeing temples in the sticky heat, a dip in the pool provides welcome relief and is one of the reason we chose this hotel.
reviews.title: OUR CAMBODIAN TRIP
Heaven
reviews.text: The hotel food was very good also. Breakfast was a choice of Khmer, American and Continental and each choice was very nice. We had a late lunch there one day also and this too was excellent.

reviews.title: Bathroom is like a mini Angkor!
reviews.text: Very convenient hotel-close to centre but away from the nose of pub street. Pool was lovely after sightseeing from sunrise. Packed breakfast for early starts was a nice touch. Bathroom is unlike any I've seen -mini Angkor in your room. Buffet breakfast not always available but the a la carte was delicious (and included in room rate) if a little slow to arrive. Great coffee!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most unique hotel I have stayed in with its quaint design and decor. It just feels like you are in Siem Reap! Rooms are spacious and everything just looks good. The pool is nice for a dip from all the heat and dirt from the streets. Staff was all very friendly and helpful. The location is just 3 minutes walk to Pub Street where you can find many restaurants, pubs and everything a tourist needs! No need for tuk tuks when you stay here. The only place to avoid is the restaurant. Food was very ordinary. Many better places nearby.
reviews.title: Unique hotel at good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like to say that if you go 3 nights to Siem Reap, this hotel is a beauty. You feel like you are sleeping in the Bayon, Angkor Wat area. The hotel looks great and is great. Very old building and restored as a hotel. Very very nice rooms and big. Everywhere you go looks so beautiful and inside it looks like a tempel. The staff is very kind and do not forget the awesome pool upstairs. This place is located just perfect to go into the city and explore all the nightmarkets, bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Sleeping in the Bayon

reviews.text: Loved the hotel. Staff was very helpful. Location perfect.
reviews.title: Where Indiana Jones Would Stay
Great place
reviews.text: Shower had a fountain and sculpture.

After all the reviews I expected Terrasse des Elephants to be awesome, sad to say that it wasn't. You could here the electricity go on and off all night (the AC not working is not ok when you're in this climate zone!) and the hot water wasn't consistent either. The sheets are paper thin and not soft. The wifi is also very slow and patchy (it works better out on the pool terrace). The room is very charming and the hotel is fine, but i just wanted consistency in water and electricity. I will say the location is great, you can walk to the night markets, pub street, and the old market very easily and it's located only 15 minutes from the airport. If you are ok with foregoing luxury, this place is very affordable and convenient.
reviews.title: overrated hotel!

reviews.text: Location Location Location. You drive from the airport past the ugly tour group hotels getting closer to the centre of town, and you keep going - one small block back from the river and two small blocks back from the Alley. No issues with noise (low season). We had 2 rooms on Level 2 next to each other. Probably a bit quieter, but the rooms on the pool deck (Lvl 3) and above (Lvl 4) look great with city views). Pool is stunning. Staff were friendly and effective. Included breakfast and restaurant staff - great. The quaint "traditional" room decorations were a real hit with our kids. Their own temple, bridge and Lilly pond in their room. Only negative was one Lvl 2 room had a bit of a musty smell. Put the kids in there - problem solved.
reviews.title: 2 wks in Cambodia with 3 young kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel having been attracted by the reviews and the pictures of the rooms shown on the hotel website, nothing to do with the reality. The Khmer style rooms (we have changed room after the first night) were much smaller, with old furniture and, most important, very dark and with a bad smell coming from the straw covering the ceeiling.
reviews.title: where are the rooms shown on the website

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In spite of that, that resulted in an uncomfortable stay, the hotel has a beautiful pool on the roof and a very good restaurant. My suggestion however is to go to some other place to sleep, anyway.
reviews.title: Cream of the crop!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff could not have been more helpful especially the concierges. We stayed for two nights.
reviews.title: Anther great stay

aka: Terrasse Des Elephants Hotel Siem Reap
